channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As Tokyo embraces a 4-day workweek to fight ‘death by overwork,’ Japan’s new prime minister just called a 3 a.m. meeting
item.description: The Japanese leader only sleeps two to four hours a night—and has personally pledged to ditch work-life balance in favor of “work, work, work.”

item.title: U.S. Border Patrol Arrested 81 People in Charlotte, N.C.
item.description: Border Patrol agents descended on Charlotte this weekend searching for immigrants in the country illegally. It remains unclear how long the agents wil...

item.title: We Can Now Track Individual Monarch Butterflies. It’s a Revelation.
item.description: Scientists used tiny new sensors to follow the insects on journeys that take thousands of miles to their winter colonies in Mexico.

item.title: Remote professionals are quiet quitting Fridays. Their rebellion could open the door to a 4-day work week
item.description: The American Time Use Survey shows that from 2019 to 2024, the average number of minutes worked on Fridays fell by about 90 minutes in remote position...

item.title: Companies and countries can stay nimble even as they navigate the ‘unexploded ordinance’ of U.S.-China competition, experts say
item.description: There's “incredibly high stakes" on the geopolitical front, foreign policy expert James Crabtree said during the Fortune Innovation Forum.

item.title: Meet the dads choosing caring for kids over careers: ‘Men are starting to realize that missing crucial morning time and bedtime adds up’
item.description: Not a single stay-at-home father that Fortune spoke to had any regrets about swapping sending emails for changing diapers.

item.title: America’s path out of $38 trillion national debt crisis likely involves pushing up inflation and ‘eroding Fed independence,’ says JPMorgan Private Bank
item.description: The government could "tolerate stronger growth and higher inflation, allowing real interest rates to fall and the debt burden to shrink over time," JP...

item.title: With Ukraine’s Cash Running Low, Europe Lacks a Good Plan B
item.description: The European Union wants to finance Ukraine’s war efforts using a loan based on Russia’s frozen assets in Belgium. If that falls through, there’s no e...

item.title: What Russian Activists Do When They Can’t Criticize Putin
item.description: Opposition-minded Russians who remain in the country are trying to keep politically active in whatever causes they can, whether that’s recycling, clea...

item.title: France Agrees to Sell Up to 100 Fighter Jets to Ukraine
item.description: Some in Ukraine criticized the 10-year timeline for the warplanes and other defense equipment, but France called it a long-term commitment to the coun...

item.title: Polish Railway Explosion Was Sabotage, Prime Minister Says
item.description: Donald Tusk said unidentified saboteurs had tried to “blow up a train” on a route crucial for getting aid into Ukraine.

item.title: With Ukraine’s Cash Running Low, Europe Lacks a Good Plan B
item.description: The European Union wants to finance Ukraine’s war efforts using a loan based on Russia’s frozen assets in Belgium. If that falls through, there’s no e...

item.title: France Agrees to Sell Up to 100 Rafale Fighter Jets to Ukraine
item.description: Some in Ukraine criticized the 10-year timeline for the warplanes and other defense equipment, but France called it a long-term commitment to the coun...

item.title: Drawing Religion Minister’s Ire, Music Video is Pulled by Universal in Malaysia
item.description: The minister criticized the girl band Dolla for wearing revealing outfits in a clip for their hit “Question.” He also threatened criminal action.
